Package frc.team1711.swerve.util.odometry

Class Position

  • java.lang.Object
    • frc.team1711.swerve.util.odometry.Position
  • public class Position
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents position of the robot on the field, with location and direction components. Used with the AutoSwerveDrive subsystem.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Position​(Vector location, double direction)
      Creates a new robot Position.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Position addMovementVector​(Vector movement)
      Adds a movement Vector to this Position to return a new Position.
      double distanceFrom​(Position other)
      Gets the distance from this position to another on the field, in inches.
      double getDirection()
      Gets the robot's direction relative to the field, in degrees.
      Vector getLocation()
      Gets the location of the robot on the field as a vector, measured in inches.
      Vector movementTo​(Position other)
      Gets a vector representing the movement required to move the robot from this position to another on the field.
      Position withDirection​(double newDir)
      Returns a new Position with the same location but a different direction.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Position

        public Position​(Vector location,
                double direction)
        Creates a new robot Position.

        The direction of the robot position is not the same measure as GyroSwerveDrive.getGyroAngle(). getGyroAngle() is only used for GyroSwerveDrive.fieldRelativeUserInputDrive() (that is, field relative teleop), whereas Position.direction is used for autonomous functionality.

        Parameters:
        location - A Vector representing the robot's location on the field, measured in inches.
        direction - A double representing the direction angle of the robot, measured in degrees.

    • Method Detail

      • addMovementVector

        public Position addMovementVector​(Vector movement)
        Adds a movement Vector to this Position to return a new Position.
        Parameters:
        movement - The movement vector to add, measured in inches.
        Returns:
        This same Position, with a movement Vector added to the location.

      • withDirection

        public Position withDirection​(double newDir)
        Returns a new Position with the same location but a different direction.
        Parameters:
        newDir - The direction for the new position, measured in degrees.
        Returns:
        The new Position.

      • getLocation

        public Vector getLocation()
        Gets the location of the robot on the field as a vector, measured in inches.
        Returns:
        The location of the robot on the field.

      • getDirection

        public double getDirection()
        Gets the robot's direction relative to the field, in degrees. A turn to the right will increase this measure.

        The direction of the robot position is not the same measure as GyroSwerveDrive.getGyroAngle(). getGyroAngle() is only used for GyroSwerveDrive.fieldRelativeUserInputDrive() (that is, field relative teleop), whereas Position.direction is used for autonomous functionality.

        Returns:
        The robot's direction

      • movementTo

        public Vector movementTo​(Position other)
        Gets a vector representing the movement required to move the robot from this position to another on the field.
        Parameters:
        other - The position to get the movement to
        Returns:
        A vector representing the movement from this position to another. Units are in inches.

      • distanceFrom

        public double distanceFrom​(Position other)
        Gets the distance from this position to another on the field, in inches.
        Parameters:
        other - The position to get the distance from
        Returns:
        The distance from this position to the other
